p: The incidence of GH is on the rise, bringing great pain to patients and causing increased rates of fetal abortion, permanent nerve injury, and neonatal malformation through placental transmission ( Schiffer and Gottlieb, 2017). At present, nucleoside drugs such as acyclovir, ganciclovir, and penciclovir are commonly used to treat HSV-2 infections. These drugs inhibit the viral DNA polymerase via triphosphorylation, affecting viral replication ( Benzekri et al., 2018). However, drug resistance rates are increasing, especially among immunosuppressed individuals ( Dai et al., 2018). There is currently no effective HSV-2 vaccine ( Churqui et al., 2018), so the exploration of natural plant pharmaceuticals and their active components has become a hot spot in the development of new antiviral drugs ( Kesharwani et al., 2017; Yildirim et al., 2016).
